french.text: When he was fifteen the devil was a good looking boy.
There is no pillow so soft as a clear conscience.
Tout ce qui brille n'est pas or
french.description: An apple a day keeps the doctor away.

french.text: Il vaut mieux être marteau qu'enclume.
french.description: It's better to be a hammer than a nail.

french.text: Il vaut mieux s'adresser à Dieu qu'à ses saints.
french.description: it's better to talk to the organ-grinder than the monkey.

french.text: Aide-toi, le ciel t'aidera.
french.description: Heaven helps those who help themselves.

french.text: Au royaume des aveugles les borgnes sont rois.
french.description: In the kingdom of the blind the one-eyed man is king.

french.text: C'est la poule qui chante qui a fait l'oeuf.
french.description: The guilty dog barks the loudest.

french.text: Ce sont les tonneaux vides qui font le plus de bruit.
french.description: Empty vessels make the most noise.

french.text: À l'impossible nul n'est tenu.
french.description: No one is bound to do the impossible.

french.text: À l'oeuvre on reconnaît l'artisan.
french.description: You can tell an artist by his handiwork.

french.text: Il ne faut jamais mettre la charrue avant les boeufs.
french.description: Don't put the cart before the horse.

french.text: Il ne faut pas vendre la peau de l'ours avant de l'avoir tué.
french.description: Don't count your chickens before they're hatched.

french.text: À mauvais ouvrier point de bons outils.
french.description: A bad workman blames his tools.

french.text: Il faut toujours qu'il ramène sa fraise.
french.description: He always has to put his two cents in.

french.text: Ne tourne pas autour du pot.
french.description: Don't beat around the bush.

french.text: Qui se ressemble s'assemble.
french.description: Birds of a feather flock together.

french.text: Qui naît poule aime à caqueter.
french.description: A leopard can't change his spots.

french.text: L'habit ne fait pas le moine.
french.description: Clothes don't make the person.

french.text: Qui trop embrasse mal étreint.
french.description: He who grasps at too much loses everything.

french.text: Heureux au jeu, malheureux en amour. (il ne faut rien laisser au hasard)
french.description: Lucky at cards, unlucky in love.

french.text: C'est facile comme tout.
french.description: It's as easy as pie.

french.text: C'est plus facile à dire qu'à faire.
french.description: Easier said than done.

french.text: Paris ne s'est pas fait en un jour.
french.description: Rome wasn't built in a day.

french.text: Il faut laisser faire le temps.
french.description: Let things take/follow their [natural] course.

french.text: À quelque-chose malheur est bon. (Après la pluie le beau temps)
french.description: Every cloud has a silver lining.

french.text: Bon chien chasse de race.
french.description: Like father, like son.

french.text: Les petits ruisseaux font les grandes rivières.
french.description: Tall oaks from little acorns grow.

french.text: Les chiens ne font pas des chats.
french.description: The apple doesn't fall far from the tree.

french.text: C'est au pied du mur qu'on voit le maçon.
french.description: The tree is known by its fruit.

french.text: Bonne renommée vaut mieux que ceinture dorée.
french.description: A good name is better than riches.

french.text: Les bons comptes font les bons amis.
french.description: Don't let money squabbles ruin a friendship.

french.text: Battre le fer pendant qu'il est chaud.
french.description: To strike while the iron is hot.

french.text: Entre l'arbre et l'écorce il ne faut pas mettre le doigt.
french.description: Caught between a rock and a hard place.

french.text: Il y a un temps pour tout.
french.description: There's a right time for everything.

french.text: Le temps c'est de l'argent.
french.description: Time is money.

french.text: Le temps perdu ne se rattrape jamais.
french.description: Time and tide wait for no man.

french.text: Quand on parle du loup (on en voit la queue).
french.description: Speak of the devil (and he appears).

french.text: Un chien vivant vaut mieux qu'un lion mort.
french.description: A bird in the hand is worth two in the bush.

french.text: Aux grands maux les grands remèdes.
french.description: Desperate times call for desperate measures, big problems require big solutions.

french.text: Le chat parti, les souris dansent. (Quand le chat n'est pas là les souris dansent)
french.description: When the cat's away, the mice will play.

french.text: Nécessité fait loi. (Faute de grives, on mange des merles)
french.description: Beggars can't be choosers.

french.text: Ne mets pas tous tes oeufs dans le même panier.
french.description: Don't put all your eggs in one basket.

french.text: On ne fait pas d'omelette sans casser des oeufs.
french.description: You can't make an omelet without breaking eggs.

french.text: The shoemakers are always the most badly shod.
french.description: The shoemaker's always goes barefoot.

french.text: Avec des si et des mais, on mettrait Paris dans une bouteille.
french.description: If ifs and ands were pots and pans there'd be no work for tinkers' hands.

french.text: Il vaut mieux aller au moulin qu'au médecin.
french.description: All that glitters isn't gold

french.text: Quand le chat n'est pas là, les souris dansent.
french.description: When the cat's away, the mice will play

french.text: Impossible n'est pas français.
french.description: There's no such thing as can't

french.description: Rome is a great city. However, it took many years to be completed. The builders did not rush to complete their work and neither should you. If you wish to create something wonderful and long-lasting, you will have to spend more than a day working on it. You will probably have to spend several days, weeks or even months to do a good job. Take your time and do it right!

french.description: When you are a visitor somewhere away from home, you should act like everyone else. It is polite to do so, and could keep you from getting into trouble. This proverb is from the ancient days of the Roman Empire when the capital city had visitors from all over the world. Cultures were very different between cities in those times. But while in Rome, one would behave like a Roman, no matter where you came from.

french.description: Things are not always what they seem. This proverb teaches you not to make judgments about other people because of how they look or dress. A book with a boring or plain cover could be amazing. The same is true with people. A person might look like an athlete or fool, but there is probably a lot more to them than clothes suggest.

french.description: on s’abrutit à toujours travailler

french.text: An apple a day keeps the doctor away  /  La pomme du matin tue le médecin
french.description: une pomme par jour, en forme toujours

french.text: An Englishman’s home is his castle  /  Chacun est roi en sa maison
french.description: charbonnier est maître chez soi.

french.text: An eye for an eye, a tooth for a tooth
french.description: œil pour œil, dent pour dent

french.text: An idle mind (var. brain) is the devil’s workshop
french.description: l’oisiveté est mère de tous les vices

french.text: Any port in storm
french.description: nécessité fait loi

french.text: Appearances are deceptive
french.description: les apparences sont trompeuses

french.text: Art is long, life is short
french.description: l’art est long, la vie est courte

french.text: As well be hanged for a sheep as a lamb  /  Tant qu’à être pendu pour un mouton , autant l’ être pour un agneau !
french.description: quitte à être puni, autant que cela en vaille la peine !

french.text: As you make your bed, so you must lie in it
french.description: comme on fait son lit, on se couche

french.text: As you sow, so shall you reap
french.description: quand le vin est tiré, il faut le boire

french.text: Ask no questions and be told no lies
french.description: ne pas se poser de questions, c’est se garantir des mensonges

french.text: Bad news travels fast
french.description: les nouvelles vont vite

french.text: Barking dogs seldom bite  /  Chien qui aboie ne mord pas
french.description: les chiens aboient, la caravane passe

french.text: Beauty is but skin deep
french.description: la beauté n’est pas tout

french.text: Beauty is in the eye of the beholder  /  La beauté est affaire de goût
french.description: il n’y a pas de laides amours

french.text: Beggars can’t be choosers  /  Nécessité fait loi
french.description: un mendiant n’a pas le choix

french.text: Beginner’s luck
french.description: aux innocents les mains pleines

french.text: Better be envied than pitied
french.description: mieux vaut faire pitié qu’envie

french.text: Better be the head of a dog than the tail of a lion
french.description: mieux vaut être tête de chien (var. souris) que queue de lion

french.text: Better bend than break
french.description: mieux vaut plier que rompre

french.text: Better brain than brawn
french.description: mieux vaut de la cervelle que du muscle

french.text: Better late than never
french.description: mieux vaut tard que jamais

french.text: Better safe than sorry  /  Mieux vaut sauf que désolé  /  Prudence est mère de sécurité
french.description: mieux vaut prévenir que guérir

french.text: Better the devil you know than the devil you don’t know
french.description: on sait ce que l’on quitte, on ne sait pas ce que l’on prend

french.text: Better to get an egg today than a hen tomorrow  /  Il vaut mieux tenir que courir
french.description: un tiens vaut mieux que deux tu l’auras

french.text: Birds in their little nests agree
french.description: ce n’est pas beau de se disputer (se dit aux enfants)

french.text: Birds of a feather flock together  /  Qui se ressemble s’assemble
french.description: chacun aime son semblable

french.text: Blessed is he who expects nothing, for he shall never be disappointed
french.description: bienheureux celui qui n’attend rien, car il ne sera point déçu

french.text: Blood is thicker than water
french.description: la voix du sang parle toujours plus fort que les autres

french.text: Boys will be boys  /  Les garçons seront toujours des garçons
french.description: il faut que jeunesse se passe

french.text: Bread is the staff of life  /  Le pain est le soutien de la vie
french.description: il faut du pain pour vivre

french.text: Brevity is the soul of wit  /  La concision est le secret d’un bon mot d’esprit
french.description: les plaisanteries les plus courtes sont les meilleures

french.text: Brother will turn on brother
french.description: l’homme est un loup pour l’homme

french.text: Call a spade a spade
french.description: il faut appeler un chat un chat

french.text: Call no man happy till he is dead
french.description: nul avant de mourir ne peut être dit heureux (æschylus)

french.text: Catch your bear before you sell its skin
french.description: il ne faut pas vendre la peau de l’ours avant de l’avoir tué

french.text: Cast ne’er a clout till May is out  /  Ne’er cast the clout ere may is out
french.description: en avril, n’ôte pas un fil, en mai fais ce qu’il te plaît

french.text: Charity begins at home  /  Charité bien ordonnée commence par soi-même
french.description: la charité commence chez soi

french.text: Charity covers a multitude of sins
french.description: qui prend, s’oblige

french.text: Charity will be rewarded in heaven
french.description: qui donne aux pauvres prête à dieu

french.text: Children should be seen and not heard
french.description: on dit voir les enfants et non pas les entendre

french.text: Christmas comes but once a year
french.description: ce n’est pas tous les jours fête

french.text: Circumstances alter cases  /  Il faut tenir compte des circonstances
french.description: il faut considérer chaque cas particulier

french.text: Clothes do not make the man
french.description: l’habit ne fait pas le moine

french.text: Coming events cast their shadows before
french.description: les événements présentent toujours des signes avant-coureurs

french.text: Comparisons are odious
french.description: comparaisons sont odieuses

french.text: Constant dripping wears away the stone
french.description: goutte à goutte l’eau creuse la pierre

french.text: Curiosity killed the cat
french.description: la curiosité est un vilain défaut

french.text: Curses, like chickens, come home to roost  /  On est puni par où on a péché
french.description: le mal retourne à celui qui l’a fait

french.text: Cut your coat according to your cloth  /  Il faut tailler la robe selon le drap  (var. son manteau selon son drap)
french.description: gouverne ta bouche selon ta bourse

french.text: Dead men tell no tales
french.description: morte la bête, mort le venin

french.text: Death is the great leveller
french.description: la mort égalise toutes les conditions

french.text: Delay breeds danger
french.description: le retard est le père de mille embarras

french.text: Desert and reward seldom keep company
french.description: jamais à bon chien il ne vient un os

french.text: Desperate diseases must have desperate remedies
french.description: à mal désespéré, remède héroïque

french.text: Desperate times, desperate measures
french.description: aux grands maux les grands remèdes

french.text: Diamond cuts diamond  /  Le diamant taille le diamant
french.description: fin contre fin n’est pas bon à faire doublure

french.text: Discretion is the better part of valour
french.description: prudence est mère de sûreté

french.text: Distance lends enchantment to the view
french.description: l’éloignement augmente le prestige

french.text: Do as I say, not as I do
french.description: fais ce que je dis, non ce que je fais

french.text: Do as you would be done by
french.description: ne fais pas aux autres ce que tu ne voudrais pas qu’ils te fassent

french.text: Do not halloo you are out of the wood  /  Il ne faut pas se moquer des chiens avant qu’on ne soit hors du village
french.description: il ne faut pas crier victoire trop tôt

french.text: Do not put new wine into old bottles
french.description: on ne met pas de vin nouveau dans de vieilles outres

french.text: Dog does not eat dog
french.description: les loups ne se mangent pas entre eux

french.text: Don’t bark, if you can’t bite
french.description: si tu ne peux mordre, ne montre pas les dents

french.text: Don’t change horses in mid-stream
french.description: il ne faut pas changer de cheval au milieu du gué

french.text: Don’t count your chickens before they are hatched
french.description: il ne faut pas vendre la peau de l’ours avant de l’avoir tué

french.text: Don’t cross a bridge till you come to it
french.description: chaque chose en son temps

french.text: Don’t cut off your nose to spite your face
french.description: tel croit venger sa honte qui l’augmente

french.text: Don’t eat the calf in the cow’s belly
french.description: il ne faut pas manger son blé en herbe

french.text: Don’t judge a book by its cover  /  La couverture ne fait pas le livre
french.description: il ne faut pas se fier aux apparences

french.text: Don’t look a gift horse in the mouth
french.description: à cheval donné on ne regarde pas les dents

french.text: Don’t put all your eggs in one (var. the same) basket
french.description: il ne faut pas mettre tout ses œufs dans le même panier

french.text: Don’t put the cart before the horse
french.description: il ne faut pas mettre la charrue avant les bœufs

french.text: Dry bargains are seldom successful
french.description: marché qu’on n’arrose pas, vous reste souvent sur les bras

french.text: Dumb folks get no land
french.description: un muet ne trouve pas sa route

french.text: Early to bed and early to rise, makes a man healthy, wealthy and wise
french.description: se coucher tôt, se lever tôt, c’est amasser santé, richesse et sagesse

french.text: Early sow, early mow
french.description: semailles hâtives avancent la moisson

french.text: Easy come, easy go  /  Ce qui vient facilement, s’en va de même
french.description: ce qui vient de la flûte s’en retourne au tambour

french.text: Empty vessels make the most noise  /  Ceux qui en disent le plus en savent le moins
french.description: les grands diseurs ne sont pas les grands faiseurs

french.text: Even a worm will turn
french.description: il y a des limites à tout

french.text: Even the best of friends must part
french.description: les meilleures choses ont une fin

french.text: Ever drunk, ever dry
french.description: plus on boit, plus on veut boire

french.text: Every bean has its black
french.description: toute fève a son point noir

french.text: Every bird must hatch her own eggs
french.description: à la pondeuse d’être couveuse

french.text: Every bullet has its billet
french.description: toute balle a sa destination

french.text: Every cloud has a silver lining
french.description: après la pluie, le beau temps

french.text: Every dog has its day
french.description: chacun a son jour de gloire

french.text: Every flood has its ebb  /  Nul flux sans reflux
french.description: toute médaille a son revers

french.text: Every Jack has his Jill  /  À chacun sa chacune
french.description: à chaque pot son couvercle

french.text: Every miller draws water to his mill
french.description: chacun prêche pour son saint

french.text: Every one has a right to his own
french.description: chacun le sien n’est pas trop

french.text: Every one must live by his calling  /  Il faut que chacun vive de son métier
french.description: tout métier doit rapporter

french.text: Every penny counts
french.description: un sou est un sou

french.text: Every thing has its time
french.description: chaque chose a son temps

french.text: Every truth ought not to be told
french.description: toutes vérités ne sont pas bonnes à dire

french.text: Experience is the mistress of fools
french.description: tête légère n’apprend rien que par expérience

french.text: Familiarity breeds contempt
french.description: la familiarité engendre le mépris

french.text: Fine feathers make fine birds
french.description: la belle plume fait le bel oiseau

french.text: First come, first served
french.description: premier arrivé, premier servi

french.text: Flies are not to be caught with vinegar
french.description: on ne prend pas les mouches avec du vinaigre

french.text: Forewarned is forearmed
french.description: un homme averti en vaut deux

french.text: Fortune lost, nothing lost
french.description: plaie d’argent n’est pas mortelle

french.text: From the sublime to the ridiculous is but a step
french.description: du sublime au ridicule, il n’y a qu’un pas

french.text: Gather thistles, expect prickles
french.description: qui s’y frotte s’y pique.

french.text: Give a dog a bad name, and hang him
french.description: qui veut tuer son chien, l’accuse de la rage

french.text: Give a thing and take a thing  /  Donne si tu veux recevoir
french.description: on ne donne rien pour rien

french.text: Give credit where credit is due
french.description: il faut rendre à césar ce qui est à césar et à dieu ce qui est à dieu

french.text: Give some and keep the rest
french.description: donne l’os au chien pour qu’il ne convoite pas ta viande

french.text: Good neighbours are hard to find
french.description: les bons voisins sont difficiles à trouver

french.text: Good wine needs no bush
french.description: à bon vin point d’enseigne

french.text: Good words break no bones
french.description: douce parole n’écorche pas langue

french.text: Grasp all, lose all
french.description: qui trop embrasse, mal étreint

french.text: Half a loaf is better than no bread
french.description: faute de grives on mange des merles

french.text: Heaven helps those who help themselves
french.description: aide-toi, le ciel t’aidera

french.text: Haste makes waste
french.description: souvent tout gâte qui trop se hâte

french.text: Hell is paved with good intentions
french.description: l’enfer est pavé de bonnes intentions

french.text: He that will not when he may, when he will, shall oft have nay
french.description: qui ne fait pas quand il peut, il ne fait pas quand il veut

french.text: He who laughs last laughs best
french.description: rira bien qui rira le dernier

french.text: He who pays the piper calls the tune
french.description: qui paie les pipeaux, commande la musique

french.text: He who steals a pin, will steal a greater thing  /  He that will steal a penny will steal a pound
french.description: qui vole un œuf vole un bœuf

french.text: Honesty is the best policy
french.description: l’honnêteté est la meilleure des recettes

french.text: Hunger breeds quarrels
french.description: les chevaux se battent quand il n’y a rien au ratelier

french.text: Hunger is the best sauce  (var. spice) /  À bon appétit il ne faut point de sauce
french.description: bon repas doit commencer par la faim

french.text: If wishes were horses, then beggars might ride
french.description: avec des si, on mettrait paris en bouteille

french.text: Ill gotten seldom prosper
french.description: bien mal acquis ne profite jamais

french.text: In for a penny, in for a pound
french.description: quand le vin est tiré, il faut le boire

french.text: In the land of the blind, the one-eyed man is king
french.description: au royaume des aveugles, les borgnes sont les rois

french.text: It is a sorry mouse that has but one hole
french.description: souris qui n’a qu’un trou est bientôt prise

french.text: It is the last straw that breaks the camel’s back
french.description: c’est la goutte d’eau qui fait déborder le vase

french.text: It is truth only which gives offence
french.description: il n’y a que la vérité qui offense

french.text: It never rains but it pours
french.description: un malheur ne vient jamais seul

french.text: It’s better to be a hammer than a nail
french.description: il vaut mieux être le marteau que l’enclume

french.text: It’s never too late to mend
french.description: il n’est jamais trop tard pour bien faire

french.text: It’s no use crying over spilt milk
french.description: ce qui est fait est fait

french.text: It takes all sorts to make a world
french.description: il faut de tout pour faire un monde

french.text: Jack is as good as his master
french.description: tel maître, tel valet

french.text: Jack of all trades, master of none
french.description: bon à tout, bon à rien

french.text: Kill not the goose that lays the golden eggs
french.description: il ne faut pas tuer la poule aux œufs d’or

french.text: Laughter is the best medicine
french.description: mieux vaut rire que pleurrer

french.text: Let sleeping dogs lie
french.description: il ne faut pas réveiller le chat qui dort

french.text: Let well alone
french.description: le mieux est l’ennemi du bien.

french.text: Life is not all beer and skittles
french.description: la vie n’est pas un long fleuve tranquille

french.text: Like father, like son
french.description: tel père, tel fils

french.text: Live and let live
french.description: il faut que tout le monde vive

french.text: Love is blind
french.description: l’amour est aveugle

french.text: Man does not live by bread alone
french.description: l’homme ne vit pas que d’eau fraiche

french.text: Man lives by hope
french.description: l’espoir fait vivre

french.text: Manners maketh the man
french.description: un homme n’est rien sans les manières

french.text: Man proposes, God disposes
french.description: l’homme propose, dieu dispose

french.text: Many a mickle makes a muckle
french.description: les petits ruisseaux font les grandes rivières

french.text: Many a true word is spoken in jest
french.description: on dit souvent la vérité en riant

french.text: Many words will not fill a bushel
french.description: autant en emporte le vent

french.text: Marry in haste, repent at leisure
french.description: qui se marie à la hâte se repent à loisir

french.text: Money does not grow on trees  /  L’argent ne tombe pas du ciel
french.description: l’argent ne se trouve pas sous le sabot d’un cheval

french.text: More haste, less speed
french.description: hâte-toi lentement

french.text: Never put off till tomorrow what you can do today
french.description: il ne faut jamais remettre au lendemain ce qu’on peut faire le jour même

french.text: Never say die
french.description: il ne faut jamais désespérer

french.text: Never say never
french.description: il ne faut jamais dire : fontaine, je ne boirai pas de ton eau

french.text: No man is a hero to his valet
french.description: il n’y a pas de héros pour son valet de chambre

french.text: No news is good news
french.description: pas de nouvelle, bonne nouvelle

french.text: Nothing ventured, nothing gained
french.description: qui ne tente rien, n’a rien

french.text: Old habits die hard
french.description: l’habitude est une seconde nature

french.text: Once bitten, twice shy
french.description: chat échaudé craint l’eau froide

french.text: Once in while does no harm
french.description: une fois n’est pas coutume

french.text: One man’s drink (var. meat) is another man’s poison
french.description: ce qui convient à quelqu’un peut être néfaste pour un autre

french.text: One must choose the lesser of two evils
french.description: de deux maux il faut choisir le moindre

french.text: One must run with the hare and hunt with the hounds
french.description: il faut ménager la chèvre et le chou

french.text: One swallow does not make a summer
french.description: une hirondelle ne fait pas le printemps

french.text: Out of sight, out of mind
french.description: loin des yeux, loin du cœur

french.text: Other times, other manners  /  Other days, other ways
french.description: autres temps, autres mœurs

french.text: Patience brings all things about
french.description: tout vient à point à qui sait attendre

french.text: People who live in glass houses should not throw stones
french.description: mieux vaut commencer par balayer devant sa porte

french.text: Plenty is no plague
french.description: abondance de biens ne nuit pas

french.text: Practice makes perfect
french.description: c’est en forgeant qu’on devient forgeron

french.text: Prevention is better than cure
french.description: mieux vaut prévenir que guérir

french.text: Rome was not built in one day
french.description: rome ne s’est pas faite en un jour

french.text: Seek and you shall find
french.description: qui cherche trouve

french.text: Silence gives consent
french.description: qui ne dit mot consent

french.text: Sleep on it
french.description: la nuit porte conseil

french.text: Sleeping dogs don’t bite
french.description: il ne faut pas éveiller le chat qui dort

french.text: Slow and steady wins the race
french.description: rien ne sert de courir, il faut partir à point

french.text: Sow the wind, reap the whirlwind  /  He who sows the wind shall reap the whirlwind
french.description: qui sème le vent, récolte la tempête

french.text: Spare the rod and spoil the child
french.description: qui aime bien châtie bien

french.text: Speech is silver, silence is golden
french.description: la parole est d’arent mais le silence est d’or

french.text: Sue a beggar, and catch a louse
french.description: à colleter un gueux, on devient pouilleux

french.text: Sufficient unto the day is the evil thereof
french.description: a chaque jour suffit sa peine

french.text: Take care of the pennies and the pounds will take care of themselves  /  Il n’y a pas de petites économies  /  Les petits ruisseaux font les grandes rivières
french.description: si l’on fait attention à chaque centime, notre fortune est faite

french.text: Tall oaks from little acorns grow
french.description: les petits ruisseaux font les grandes rivières

french.text: The bait hides the hook
french.description: on chatouille la truite pour mieux la prendre

french.text: The best fish swim near the bottom
french.description: les meilleurs poissons nagent près du fond

french.text: The best is often the enemy of the good
french.description: le mieux est l’ennemi du bien

french.text: The biter is sometimes bit
french.description: souvent les railleurs sont raillés

french.text: The cobbler’s children go barefoot
french.description: les cordonniers sont les plus mal chaussés

french.text: The covetous man, like a dog in a wheel, roasts meat for others
french.description: l’avare, comme le chien de cuisine, tourne la broche pour autrui

french.text: The cowl does not make the monk
french.description: l’habit ne fait pas le moine

french.text: The darkest hour is just before dawn
french.description: la nuit porte conseil

french.text: The devil is not so black as he is painted
french.description: le diable n’est pas toujours aussi noir qu’il en a l’air

french.text: The early bird catches the worm
french.description: l’avenir appartient à ceux qui se lèvent tôt

french.text: The fewer, the better cheer
french.description: moins nous serons, plus nous mangerons

french.text: The leopard cannot change its spots
french.description: chassez le naturel, il revient au galop

french.text: The more haste the worse speed
french.description: plus on se presse, moins on avance

french.text: The more the merrier
french.description: plus on est de fous, plus on rit

french.text: The opera ain’t over till the fat lady sings
french.description: l’opéra n’est pas fini tant que la grosse n’a pas chanté (= ce n’est fini qu’à la fin)

french.text: The perfection of art, is to conceal art
french.description: la grande finesse n’est pas celle qui s’aperçoit

french.text: The proof of the pudding is in the eating
french.description: c’est au pied du mur qu’on voit le maçon

french.text: The road to Hell is paved with good intentions
french.description: l’enfer est pavé de bonnes intentions

french.text: The sun shines on the evil and on the good  (var. for one and all)
french.description: le soleil luit pour tout le monde

french.text: There are none so blind as they who will not see
french.description: il n’est pire aveugle que celui qui ne veut pas voir

french.text: There are plenty more fish in the sea
french.description: un(e) de perdu(e), dix de trouvé(e)s

french.text: There is a season for everything
french.description: il y a un temps pour tout

french.text: There is no fool like an old fool
french.description: il n’y a pire imbécile qu’un vieil imbécile

french.text: There is no place like home
french.description: rien ne vaut son chez soi

french.text: There is no rose without a thorn
french.description: pas de rose sans épine

french.text: There is no use crying over spilt milk
french.description: ce qui est fait est fait

french.text: There’s no smoke without fire
french.description: il n’y a pas de fumée sans feu

french.text: There’s none as deaf as those who will not hear
french.description: il n’est pire sourd que celui qui ne veut pas entendre

french.text: Tide and time wait for no man
french.description: le temps perdu ne se rattrape jamais

french.text: Time brings all things to light
french.description: tout se découvre avec le temps

french.text: Time is money
french.description: le temps, c’est de l’argent

french.text: Time will tell
french.description: qui vivra verra

french.text: Tomorrow is another day
french.description: demain il fera jour

french.text: Too many cooks spoil the broth  /  Trop de marmitons gâtent la sauce
french.description: autant de têtes, autant d’avis

french.text: Truth hurts
french.description: il n’y a que la vérité qui blesse

french.text: Two heads are better than one
french.description: deux avis valent mieux qu’un

french.text: Unity is strength  /  United we stand, divided we fall
french.description: l’union fait la force

french.text: Waste not want not
french.description: qui ne tente rien n’a rien

french.text: We must walk before we run
french.description: il ne faut pas voler avant d’avoir des ailes

french.text: What cannot be cured must be endured
french.description: il faut souffrir ce qu’on ne saurait empêcher

french.text: What goes around, comes around
french.description: on récolte ce que l’on sème

french.text: What is sauce for the goose is sauce for the gander
french.description: sauce bonne pour l’oie est bonne pour le jars

french.text: What’s bred in the bone will come out in the flesh  /  La caque sent toujours le hareng
french.description: chassez le naturel, il revient au galop

french.text: When good cheer is lacking, friends will be packing
french.description: cuisine mangée, amis dispersés

french.text: When one door shuts, another opens
french.description: là ou une porte se ferme, une autre s’ouvre

french.text: Where bees are, there will be honey
french.description: où il y a des abeilles, il y aura du miel

french.text: Where there is a will there is a way  /  Vouloir c’est pouvoir
french.description: quand on veut, on peut

french.text: While the cat is away, the mice will play
french.description: quand le chat n’est pas là, les souris dansent

french.text: While the grass grows, the steer starves
french.description: à attendre que l’herbe pousse, le bœuf meurt de faim

french.text: While there is life, there is hope
french.description: tant qu’il y a de la vie, il y a de l’espoir

french.text: You can catch more flies with honey than with vinegar
french.description: on attrape plus de mouches avec du miel qu’avec du vinaigre

french.text: You can’t have your cake and eat it
french.description: on ne peut pas avoir le beurre et l’argent du beurre

french.text: You can’t make a silk purse out of a sow’s ear
french.description: l’habit ne fait pas le moine

french.text: You can’t teach an old dog new tricks  /  You can’t teach Granny to suck eggs
french.description: ce n’est pas à un vieux singe qu’on apprend à faire des grimaces

french.text: You reap what you sow
french.description: qui sème le vent, récolte la tempête

french.text: Youth will have its fling
french.description: il faut bien que jeunesse se passe

french.text: You need to break the shell in order to have the almond.
Young men forgive, old men never.
Youth may stray afar yet return at last.
À bon chat bon rat.
french.description: tit for tat.

french.text: Après la pluie, le beau temps.
french.description: every cloud has a silver lining.

french.text: Aussitôt dit, aussitôt fait.
french.description: no sooner said than done.

french.text: Autres temps, autres mœurs.
french.description: other times, other customs.

french.text: Ce n’est pas à un vieux singe qu’on apprend à faire la grimace.
french.description: there’s no substitute for experience.

french.text: Chacun voit midi à sa porte.
french.description: everyone sees noon at his own door, or everyone sees things their own way.

french.text: Chat échaudé craint l’eau froide.
french.description: once bitten, twice shy.

french.text: Donne au chien l’os pour qu’il ne convoite pas ta viande.
french.description: give some and keep the rest.

french.text: Faire d’une pierre deux coups.
french.description: to kill two birds with one stone.

french.text: Il n’y a pas de fumée sans feu.
french.description: there’s no smoke without fire.

french.text: Il n’y a pas plus sourd que celui qui ne veut pas entendre.
french.description: commonly applied french proverbs flair beauty impress.

french.text: Il n’y a pas plus sourd que celui qui ne veut pas entendre.
french.description: no one is as deaf as the one who does not want to listen.

french.text: Il ne faut jamais courir deux lièvres à la fois.
french.description: don’t try to do two things at once.

french.text: Il ne faut rien laisser au hasard.
french.description: nothing should be left to chance.

french.text: Il vaut mieux prévenir que guérir.
french.description: it is better to prevent than to heal.

french.text: Il y a plus d’un âne à la foire qui s’appelle Martin.
french.description: don’t jump to conclusions.

french.text: Impossible n’est pas français.
french.description: impossible isn’t french.

french.text: Le loup retourne toujours au bois.
french.description: one always goes back to one’s roots.

french.text: Le temps, c’est de l’argent.
french.description: time is money.

french.text: Les gros poissons mangent les petits.
french.description: big fish eat little fish.

french.text: Les murs ont des oreilles.
french.description: walls have ears.

french.text: Mieux vaut tard que jamais.
french.description: better late than never.

french.text: Ne réveillez pas le chat qui dort.
french.description: don’t wake the sleeping cat.

french.text: Nécessité fait loi.
french.description: beggars can’t be choosers.

french.text: On ne change pas une équipe qui gagne.
french.description: one does not change a winning team. in other words, if it ain’t broke, don’t fix it.

french.text: On ne fait pas d’omelette sans casser des œufs.
french.description: you can’t make an omelete without breaking eggs.

french.text: Paris ne s’est pas fait en un jour!
french.description: paris was not made in a day!

french.text: Petit à petit, l’oiseau fait son nid.
french.description: little by little, the bird makes its nest.

french.text: Quand le vin est tiré, il faut le boire.
french.description: once the first step is taken there’s no going back.

french.text: Quand on a pas ce que l’on aime, il faut aimer ce que l’on a.
french.description: when one doesn’t have the things that one loves, one must love what one has.

french.text: Qui casse les verres les paie.
french.description: you pay for your mistakes.

french.text: Qui n’avance pas, recule.
french.description: who does not move forward, recedes.

french.text: Qui ne dit mot consent.
french.description: silence implies consent.

french.text: Qui terre a, guerre a.
french.description: he who has land has quarrels.

french.text: Qui veut voyager loin ménage sa monture.
french.description: he who takes it slow and steady travels a long way.

french.text: Qui vivra verra.
french.description: the future will tell.

french.text: Rien ne sert de courir, il faut partir à point.
french.description: slow and steady wins the race.

french.text: Souris qui n’a qu’un trou est bientôt prise.
french.description: better safe than sorry.

french.text: Tel père, tel fils.
french.description: like father like son.

french.text: Tout est bien qui finit bien.
french.description: all’s well that ends well.

french.text: Tout vient à point à qui sait attendre.
french.description: all things come to those who wait.

french.text: Un chien vivant vaut mieux qu’un lion mort.
french.description: a bird in the hand is worth two in the bush.

french.text: À bois noueux, hache affilée.
french.description: English equivalent: You must meet roughness with roughness

french.text: À chaque fou plaît sa marotte.
french.description: English equivalent: Every fool is pleased with his own folly.

french.text: À chaque oiseau son nid est beau.
french.description: English equivalent: The bird loves her own nest.

french.text: À goupil endormi rien ne tombe en la gueule.
french.description: English equivalent: Liars should have a good memory.

french.text: À grands maux, grands remèdes.Aux grands maux, les grands remèdes.
french.description: Desperate times call for desperate measures/Desperate diseases must have desperate cures.

french.text: À mauvais ouvrier point de bon outil.
french.description: A bad craftsman blames his tools.

french.text: À cheval donné on ne regarde pas les dentsla bride
french.description: Don’t look a gift horse in the mouth.

french.text: À confesseurs, médicins, avocats, la vérité ne cèle de ton cas.
french.description: Conceal not the truth from thy physician and lawyer.

french.text: À l’étroit mais entre amis.
french.description: Strauss, Emanuel (1994). Dictionary of European proverbs (Volume 2 ed.). Routledge. p. 1094. ISBN 0415096243.

french.text: À l’œuvre, on connaît l’artisan.
french.description: A workman is known by his chips.

french.text: À raconter ses maux, souvent on les soulage.
french.description: A problem shared is a problem halved.

french.text: À tort se lamente de la mer qui ne s’ennuie d’y retourner.
french.description: He complains wrongfully at the sea that suffer shipwreck twice.

french.text: À qui il a été beaucoup donné, il sera beaucoup demandé.
french.description: Everybody to whom much is given, much is expected.

french.text: Abondance de bien ne nuit pas.
french.description: A store is no sore; Keep a thing seven years and you’ll find a use for it.

french.text: Aide-toi et le ciel t’aidera.
french.description: Heaven helps those who help themselves.

french.text: Amour, toux et fumée en secret ne sont demeurés.
french.description: Love, smoke and cough are hard to hide.

french.text: Après la pluie, le beau temps.
french.description: After rain comes sunshine.

french.text: A tout pourquoi il y a (un) parce que.
french.description: Every why has a wherefore.

french.text: A qui la tête fait mal, souffre par tout le corps.
french.description: When the head is sick, the whole body is sick.

french.text: A vrai dire peu de paroles.
french.description: Truth gives a short answer, lies go round about.

french.text: Bacchus a noyé plus de gens que Neptune.
french.description: English equivalent: Wine has drowned more than the sea.

french.text: Beaucoup de paille, peu de grains.
french.description: Great cry and little wool.

french.text: Bien mal acquis ne profite jamais.
french.description: Ill gotten goods never prosper.

french.text: Bien nourri et mal appris.
french.description: Better fed than taught.

french.text: Bois tordu fait feu droit.
french.description: Crooked logs make straight fires.

french.text: Bon cœur ne peut mentir.
french.description: The heart sees farther than the head.

french.text: Bon marché tire agent de bourse.
french.description: If you buy cheaply, you pay dearly.

french.text: Bon sang ne saurait mentir.
french.description: Good blood always shows itself.

french.text: Bonne renommée vaut mieux que ceinture dorée.
french.description: A good name is the best of all treasures.

french.text: Bonne volonté est reputé pour le fait.
french.description: Take the will for the deed.

french.text: Bons nageurs sont à la fin noyés.
french.description: Good swimmers are often drowned.

french.text: C’est donner deux fois, donner promptement.
french.description: Translation and He gives twice, who gives in a trice.

french.text: C’est viande mal prête que lièvre en buisson.
french.description: English translation: First catch your hare and cook him.

french.text: Ce que chante la corneille, chante le corneillon.
french.description: As the old crow sings, so sing its fledglings.

french.text: Ce qui croît soudain, périt le lendemain.
french.description: Early ripe, early rotten.

french.text: Ce que l’enfant écoute au foyer, est bientôt connu jusqu’au moutier.
french.description: English translation: What children hear at home, soon flies abroad.

french.text: Ce que tout le monde dit doit être vrai.
french.description: What everybody says must be true.

french.text: Celui qui n’est pas avec moi est contre moi.
french.description: He who is not with me is against me.

french.text: Celui qui est lent à manger est lent à travailler.
french.description: Quick at meat, quick at work.

french.text: Celui que veut être jeune quand il est vieux, doit être vieux quand il est jeune.
french.description: They who would be young when they are old must be old when they are young.

french.text: Celui qui fuit de bonne heure peut combattre derechef.
french.description: He that flees and runs away might live to see another day.

french.text: C’est l’exception qui confirme la règle.
french.description: It’s the exception that proves the rule.

french.text: C’est la poule qui chante qui a fait l’œuf.
french.description: Source: Cassagne, Jean-Marie (1998). 101 French proverbs: understanding French language and culture through common sayings. McGraw-Hill. p. 49. ISBN 0844212911.

french.text: C’est le ton qui fait la chanson.
french.description: It’s not what you do it’s the way that you do it.

french.text: C’est en forgeant qu’on devient forgeron.
french.description: Practice makes perfect.

french.text: C’est trop d’un ennemi et pas assez de cent amis.
french.description: Do not think that one enemy is insignificant, or that a thousand friends are too many.

french.text: C’est vouloir prendre des lièvres au son du tambour.
french.description: Drumming is not the way to catch a hare.

french.text: Ce n’est pas la vache qui crie le plus fort qui donne le plus de lait.
french.description: It is not the hen who cackles the loudest who hatches the most eggs.

french.text: Ce qui est fait n’est plus à faire.
french.description: What is done no longer needs to be done.

french.text: Ceux que Jupiter veut perdre, il commence par leur oter la raison.
french.description: Whom God will destroy, he first make mad.

french.text: Chacun doit balayer.
french.description: Everyone should sweep before his own door.

french.text: Chacun pour soi et Dieu pour tous.
french.description: Every one for himself and God for us all.

french.text: Chacun peut être riche en promesses.
french.description: Strauss, Emanuel (1994). Dictionary of European proverbs (Volume 2 ed.). Routledge. p. 765. ISBN 0415096243.

french.text: Chacun sent le mieux où le soulier le blesse.
french.description: No one knows where the shoe pinches, but he who wears it.

french.text: Chagrin partagé, chagrin diminué; plaisir partagé, plaisir doublé.
french.description: Joy shared, joy doubled: sorrow shared, sorrow halved.

french.text: Chaque chose vaut son prix.
french.description: Everything is worth its price.

french.text: Chaque jour une pomme conserve son homme.
french.description: An apple a day keeps the doctor away.

french.text: Charité bien ordonnée commence par soi-même.
french.description: Charity begins at home.

french.text: Chat échaudé craint l’eau froide.
french.description: A scalded cat fears cold water.

french.text: Chassez le naturel, il revient au galop.
french.description: Chase away the natural and it returns at a gallop.

french.text: Cherchons la femme.
french.description: Let us look for the woman.

french.text: Chien qui aboie ne mord pas.
french.description: Barking dogs seldom bite.

french.text: Choisissez votre femme par l’oreille bien plus que par les yeux.
french.description: Choose a wife rather by your ear than your eye.

french.text: Comme on fait son lit, on se couche.
french.description: As you make your bed, so you must lie.

french.text: Comparaison n’est pas raison.
french.description: Comparisons are odious.

french.text: C’est dans le besoin qu’on reconnaît ses vrais amis.
french.description: A friend in need is a friend indeed.

french.text: Ce n’est pas aux vieux singes qu’on apprend à faire des grimaces.
french.description: You can’t teach an old dog new tricks.

french.text: Coffre ouvert, rend le saint pervers.
french.description: A nice wife and a back door oft make a rich man poor.

french.text: Coucher de poule et lever de corbeau écartent l’homme du tombeau.
french.description: Early to bed and early to rise makes a man healthy, wealthy, and wise.

french.text: Courte priére pénètre les cieux .
french.description: Short prayers reach heaven.

french.text: D’un costé Dieu poingt, de l’autre il vingt.
french.description: God who gives the wound gives the salve.

french.text: Dans le doute, abstiens-toi.
french.description: When in doubt, leave it out.

french.text: De la mesure dont nous mesurons les autres nous serons mesurés.
french.description: Whatever measure you deal out to others will be dealt back to you.

french.text: De mauvais grain jamais bon pain.
french.description: A golden bit does not make the horse any better.

french.text: De qui je me fie Dieu me garde.
french.description: A man’s worst enemies are often those of his own house.

french.text: De tout s’avise à qui pain faut.
french.description: Strauss, Emanuel (1998). Concise Dictionary of European Proverbs (Abbreviated ed.). Routledge. p. 638. ISBN 0415160502.

french.text: Deux ancres sont bonnes au navire.
french.description: Good riding at two anchors, men have told, for if the one fails, the other may hold.

french.text: Diviser pour régner.
french.description: Divide and conquer.

french.text: Don d’ennemi c’est malencontreux.
french.description: This advice has its root in the story of the Trojan Horse, the treacherous subterfuge by which the Greeks finally overcame their trojan adversaries at the end of the Trojan War.

french.text: Donnant donnant.
french.description: You don’t get nothing for nothing.

french.text: Donner un oeuf pour avoir une fève.
french.description: Strauss, Emanuel (1994). Dictionary of European proverbs (Volume 2 ed.). Routledge. p. 1134. ISBN 0415096243.

french.text: En peu d’heure Dieu labeure
french.description: God works in moments

french.text: En toute chose il faut considérer la fin.
french.description: Whatever you do, act wisely, and consider the end.

french.text: Entre l’arbre et l’écorce il ne faut pas mettre le doigt.
french.description: "Don’t go between the tree and the bark."

french.text: Envie est toujours en vie.
french.description: Envy takes no holiday.

french.text: Faire d’une mouche un éléphant.
french.description: Don’t make a mountain out of a molehill.

french.text: Faire le pas plus long que la jambe.
french.description: Don’t have too many irons in the fire.

french.text: Faire un cygne d’un oison.
french.description: Every man thinks his own geese swans.

french.text: Fais comme je dis, non comme j’agis.
french.description: Preachers say: Do as I say, not as I do.

french.text: Fais ce que tu peux, si tu ne peux faire ce que tu veux.
french.description: Do as you may, if you can’t do as you could.

french.text: Faute avouée est à moitié pardonnée.
french.description: A fault confessed is a half redressed.

french.text: Faute de mieux le roi couche avec sa femme.
french.description: Gnaw the bone which is fallen to thy lot.

french.text: Femme bonne vaut une couronne.
french.description: A cheerful wife is the spice of life.

french.text: Ferveur de novice ne dure pas.
french.description: New brooms sweep clean.

french.text: Folle est la brebis qui au loup se confesse.
french.description: It’s a foolish sheep that makes the wolf his confessor.

french.text: Fuis le plaisir qui amène repentir.
french.description: Avoid the pleasure which will bite tomorrow.

french.text: Gardez-vous des faux prophètes.
french.description: Beware of the false prophets, who come to you in sheep’s clothing, and inwardly are ravening wolves.

french.text: Hâtez-vous lentement.
french.description: More haste, less speed.

french.text: Heureux sont les enfants dont les pères sont damnés.
french.description: No one gets rich quickly if he is honest.

french.text: Il faut bonne mémoire après qu’on a menti .
french.description: A liar should have a good memory.

french.text: Il faut donner au diable son dû.
french.description: Give the devil his due.

french.text: Il faut casser le noyau pour en avoir l’amande.
french.description: He that would eat the kernel must crack the nut.

french.text: Il faut être matelot avant d’être capitaine.
french.description: Who has not served cannot command.

french.text: Il faut être deux pour danser le tango.
french.description: It takes two to tango.

french.text: Il faut laisser aller le monde comme il va.
french.description: We need to let the world go the way it is.

french.text: Il faut laver son linge sale en famille.
french.description: Don’t wash your dirty linen in public; It is an ill bird that fouls its own nest.

french.text: Il faut manger pour vivre, et non pas vivre pour manger.
french.description: Gluttony kills more than the sword.

french.text: Il faut prêcher d’exemple.
french.description: Lead by example.

french.text: Il faut reculer pour mieux sauter.
french.description: One must step back to take a good leap.

french.text: Il faut réfléchir avant d’agir.
french.description: Look before you leap.

french.text: Il faut qu’une porte soit ouverte ou fermée.
french.description: A door must be either shut or open.

french.text: Il faut battre le fer pendant qu’il est chaud.
french.description: Strike while the iron is hot.

french.text: Il n’est pas chance qui ne retourne.
french.description: Opportunity knocks only once.

french.text: Il n’est rien tel qui balai neuf.
french.description: A new broome sweepeth cleane.

french.text: Il ne convient pas à fol qu’on lui rende cloche au col.
french.description: A tongue of a fool carves a piece of his heart to all that sit near him.

french.text: Il ne faut jamais quitter le certain pour l’incertain.
french.description: He that leaves certainty and sticks to chance,When fools pipe, he may dance.

french.text: Il ne faut pas brûler la chandelle par les deux bouts.
french.description: Don’t burn the candles at both ends.

french.text: Il ne faut pas changer d’attelage au milieu d’un gué.
french.description: Don’t change horses in midstream.

french.text: Il ne faut pas jeter les perles devant les poureaux.
french.description: Do not throw pearls before swine.

french.text: Il ne faut pas jouer avec le feu.
french.description: Do not play with edged tools.

french.text: Il ne faut point parler de corde dans la maison d’un pendu.
french.description: Name not a rope in his house who hanged himself.

french.text: Il n’y a point d’église où le diable n’ait sa chapelle.
french.description: Where god has a church the devil will have his chapel.

french.text: Il n’y a point d’homme necessaire.
french.description: No man is indispensable.

french.text: Il n’y a que la foi que sauve.
french.description: Faith is half the battle.

french.text: Il n’est pire aveugle que celui qui ne veut pas voir.
french.description: There are none so blind as they who will not see.

french.text: Il ne faut pas faire ces choses a moitié.
french.description: If a job is worth doing, it’s worth doing well.

french.text: Il ne faut pas se fier aux apparences.
french.description: Appearances decieves.

french.text: Il ne faut pas mettre tous ses œufs dans le même panier.
french.description: Don’t put all your eggs in one basket.

french.text: Il n’y a pas de fumée sans feu.
french.description: Where there’s smoke, there’s fire.

french.text: Il ne faut pas réveiller le chat qui dort.
french.description: Let sleeping dogs lie.

french.text: Il ne faut pas vendre la peau de l’ours avant de l’avoir tué.
french.description: Don’t count your chickens before they’re hatched.

french.text: Il tirerait de l’huile d’un mur.
french.description: Derive the oil of a wall.

french.text: Il vaut mieux suer que trembler
french.description: Better to hold with the hound than run with the hare.

french.text: Il vaut mieux plier que rompre.
french.description: Better bow than break.

french.text: Il vaut mieux qu’on dise "il court-là", qu'"il gît ici".
french.description: He who fights and runs away may live to fight another day.

french.text: Il y a serpent caché sous des fleurs.
french.description: Look before you leap, for snakes among sweet flowers do creep.

french.text: Il y a péril en la demeure.
french.description: There is danger in delay.

french.text: Jamais deux sans trois.
french.description: When it rains it pours.

french.text: Jamais paresseux n’eut grande écuelle.
french.description: Poverty is the reward of idleness.

french.text: Je crains l’homme d’un seul livre.
french.description: Fear the man of one book.

french.text: Jamais honteux n’eut belle amie.
french.description: Faint heart never won fair lady.

french.text: Jeter de l’huile sur le feu.
french.description: To add fuel to the fire.

french.text: Jeunneuse pauresse, viellise pouilleuse.
french.description: Diligent youth makes easy age.

french.text: Juge hâtif est périlleux.
french.description: Quick judgments are dangerous.

french.text: L’argent est fait pour rouler.
french.description: Money is there to be spent.

french.text: L’attaque est la meilleure défence.
french.description: The best defence is a good offense.

french.text: La belle plume fait le bel oiseau.
french.description: Fine feathers make fine birds.

french.text: La confiance appelle la confiance.
french.description: Confidence begets confidence.

french.text: La femme du cordonnier est toujours mal chaussée.
french.description: The cobbler’s wife is the worst shod.

french.text: La fortune ne fait pas le bonheur.
french.description: Wealth rarely brings happiness.

french.text: La nuit tous les chats sont gris.
french.description: At night all cats are grey.

french.text: La parole a été donnée à l’homme pour déguiser sa pensée.
french.description: Men talk only to conceal the mind.

french.text: La parole s’enfuit, et l’écriture demeure.
french.description: Paper is forbearing.

french.text: La punition boite, mais elle arrive.
french.description: Punishment is lame but it comes.

french.text: La raison du plus fort est toujours la meilleure.
french.description: Might is always right.

french.text: La répétition est la mère de la mémoire.
french.description: Repetition is the mother of memory.

french.text: La seconde pensée est la meilleure.
french.description: Second thoughts are best.

french.text: La variété plaît.
french.description: Variety is the spice of life.

french.text: La vérité est dans le vin.
french.description: In wine there is truth.

french.text: La vérité se dit en badinant.
french.description: Many a true words are spoken in jest.

french.text: La parole est l’ombre du fait.
french.description: Deeds are fruits, words are but leaves.

french.text: Langue muette n’est jamais battue.
french.description: Least said, soonest mended.

french.text: L’essentiel du courage c’est la prudence.
french.description: Discretion is the better part of valor.

french.text: Le fait juge l’homme.
french.description: The proof of the pudding is in the eating.

french.text: Le mal appelle le mal.
french.description: Deep calls to deep.

french.text: Le meilleur n’en vaut rien.
french.description: Bad is the best choice.

french.text: Le miel est doux, mais l’abeille pique.
french.description: He that will not endure the bitter, will not live to see the sweet.

french.text: Les fous inventent les modes, et les sages les suivent.
french.description: A fool may give a wise man counsel.

french.text: Le plus grand malheur ou bonheur de l’homme est une femme.
french.description: English equivalents: Choose a wife rather by your ear than your eye.

french.text: La pomme ne tombe jamais loin de l’arbre.
french.description: The apple does not fall far from the tree.

french.text: Le remède est pire que le mal.
french.description: The remedy is often worse than the disease; Burn not your house to rid it off the mouse.

french.text: Le temps et l’usage rendent l’homme sage.
french.description: Books know more than years.

french.text: Le trop de précautions ne nuit jamais.
french.description: Better safe than sorry.

french.text: Les absents ont toujours tort.
french.description: The absent are always in the wrong.

french.text: Les cordonniers sont les plus mal chaussés.
french.description: The shoemaker goes barefoot.

french.text: Les goûts et les couleurs ne se discutent pas.
french.description: There’s no accounting for tastes; Different strokes suit different folks.

french.text: Les soucis font blanchir les cheveux de bonne heure.
french.description: Fretting cares make grey hairs.

french.text: L’enfer est pavé de bonnes intentions.
french.description: The road to Hell is paved with good intentions.

french.text: L’envie s’attache à la gloire.
french.description: Envy always shooteth at a high mark.

french.text: L’habit ne fait pas le moine.
french.description: You can’t judge a book by its cover.

french.text: L’histoire se répéte.
french.description: Something that has happened once can happen again.

french.text: L’homme propose, et Dieu dispose.
french.description: Man proposes, God disposes; Everything in its season.

french.text: L’honnêteté est la meilleure politique.
french.description: Honesty is the best policy.

french.text: L’on passe la haie par où elle est plus basse.
french.description: Men leap over where the hedge is lower.

french.text: L’on ne saurait écorcher une pierre.
french.description: You can’t milk a bull.

french.text: L’or force le verrou.
french.description: A golden key opens any gate but that of heaven.

french.text: Le chien aboit, la caravane passe.
french.description: The dogs bark, but the caravan passes on.

french.text: La fortune sourit aux audacieux.
french.description: Fortune favours the brave.

french.text: Le fil ténu casse.
french.description: A chain is only as strong as its weakest link.

french.text: L’espoir fait vivre.
french.description: Where there’s life, there’s hope.

french.text: Les habitudes ont la vie dure.
french.description: Old habits die hard.

french.text: Les bons comptes font les bons amis.
french.description: Short reckonings make long friends.

french.text: Le monde appartient à ceux qui se lèvent tôt.
french.description: Early to bed and early to rise, makes a man healthy, wealthy and wise.

french.text: Les apparences sont trompeuses.
french.description: All that glitters is not gold.

french.text: Les grands voleurs pendent les petits.
french.description: Men are like fish, the big ones devour the small.

french.text: Les rats quittent le navire qui coule.
french.description: Rats desert a sinking ship.

french.text: La nuit porte conseil.
french.description: Night brings counsel.

french.text: La parole est d’argent, mais le silence est d’or.
french.description: Speech is silver, Silence is golden.

french.text: Loin des yeux, loin du cœur.
french.description: Out of sight, out of mind.

french.text: Les murs ont des oreilles.
french.description: Walls have ears.

french.text: Les plaisanteries les plus courtes sont les meilleures.
french.description: Brevity is the soul of wit.

french.text: Les premiers seront les derniers.
french.description: The last will be first, and the first last.

french.text: Les volontés sont libres.
french.description: His own desire leads every man.

french.text: Mettre la charrue devant les bœufs.
french.description: Don’t put the cart before the horse.

french.text: Mieux vaut que entre fou avec tous que sage tout seul.
french.description: Better foolish by all than wise by yourself.

french.text: Mieux vaut savoir que richesse.
french.description: A good mind possess a kingdom.

french.text: Mieux vaut peu que rien.
french.description: Better an egg today than a hen tomorrow.

french.text: Mieux vaut tenir que courir.
french.description: A bird in hand is worth two in a bush.

french.text: Mieux vaut être seul que mal accompagné.
french.description: Better be alone than in bad company.

french.text: Mieux vaut faire que dire.
french.description: Well done is better than well said.

french.text: Mieux vaut prévenir que guérir.
french.description: An ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure.

french.text: Mieux vaut un présent que deux futurs.
french.description: One today is worth two tomorrows.

french.text: Nature passe nourriture, et nourriture survainc nature.
french.description: Nature is beyond all teaching.

french.text: Ne meurs cheval, herbe te vient.
french.description: While the grass grows the steed starves.

french.text: Ne te mêle pas des affaires d’autrui.
french.description: Give neither salt nor counsel till you are asked for it.

french.text: Ne touchez pas aux blessures guéries.
french.description: It is not wise to open old wounds.

french.text: La nuit porte conseil.
french.description: The night brings counsel.

french.text: Noblesse oblige.
french.description: Nobility forces.

french.text: Oignez vilain, il vous poindra. Poignez vilain, il vous oindra.
french.description: Anoint a villain, he will stab you; stab a villain, he will anoint you (oindre and poindre being outdated verbs)

french.text: On a que ce que l’on mérite.
french.description: What goes around comes around.

french.text: On ne tue pas le loup parce qu’il est gris, mais parce qu’il a dévoré la brebis.
french.description: The sin is not in the sinning, but in the being found out.

french.text: On naît poète, on devient orateur.
french.description: Poets are born, but orators are trained.

french.text: On n’est jamais si bien servi que par soi-même.
french.description: If you want something done right, do it yourself.

french.text: On revient toujoursà ses premières amours.
french.description: True love never rusts.

french.text: On ne change pas une équipe qui gagne.
french.description: If it ain’t broke, don’t fix it.

french.text: On ne fait pas boire un âne qui n’a pas soif.
french.description: You can lead a horse to water but you can’t make it drink.

french.text: On ne jette des pierres qu’a l’arbre chargé de fruits.
french.description: No enemies is a sign fortune forgotten you.

french.text: On ne peut aider qui ne veut point écouter.
french.description: He that will not be counseled cannot be helped.

french.text: On ne prend pas les oiseaux à la tartelle.
french.description: Deal gently with the bird you mean to catch.

french.text: On prend plus de mouches avec du miel qu’avec du vinaigre.
french.description: You can catch more flies with a drop of honey than with a barrel of vinegar.

french.text: Par savoir vient avoir.
french.description: Learning is the eye of the mind.

french.text: Patience et longueur de temps font plus que force ni que rage.
french.description: English equivalent. He that can have patience can have what he will.

french.text: Patience passe science.
french.description: An ounce of patience is worth a pound of brains.

french.text: Pendant le faveur de la fortune, il faut se préparer à sa défaveur.
french.description: If fortune favours, beware of being exalted; if fortune thunders, beware of being overwhelmed.

french.text: Personne ne peut être juge dans sa propre cause.
french.description: No one can be the judge in his own case.

french.text: Petit poisson deviendra grand.
french.description: The little fish will grow big.

french.text: Pierre qui roule n’amasse pas mousse.
french.description: A rolling stone gathers no moss.

french.text: Plus ça change, plus c’est la même chose.
french.description: Variant: Plus ça change, plus c’est pareil.

french.text: Pour estimer le doux, il faut goûter de l’amer.
french.description: To taste the sweet, you must taste the bitter.

french.text: Pour un de perdu, deux de retrouvés.
french.description: When one door closes another opens.

french.text: Prudence est la mère de súreté.
french.description: Diffidence is the right eye of prudence.

french.text: Quand on dîne avec le diable, il faut se munir d’une longue cuiller.
french.description: If you are going to eat with the devil, you must have a long spoon.

french.text: Quand on n’a pas ce que l’on aime, il faut aimer ce que l’on a.
french.description: If we have not the thing we love, then must we love the thing we have.

french.text: Quand on n’a pas de tête, il faut avoir des jambes.
french.description: Who falls short in the head must be long in the heels.

french.text: Quand on n’avance pas, on recule.
french.description: He who does not advance goes backwards.

french.text: Qui a age, doit être sage.
french.description: Reason does not come before years.

french.text: Qui a bu, boira.
french.description: Once a drunkard always a drunkard; Once a thief always a thief.

french.text: Qui a froid souffle le feu.
french.description: English equivalent: Fuel without fire is soon quenched.

french.text: Qui a tête de cire ne doit pas s’approcher du feu.
french.description: He who has a wax head must not go near the fire.

french.text: Qui aime Dieu est sûr en tout lieu.
french.description: He who serves God has a good master.

french.text: Que bien aime, tard oublie.
french.description: True love never grows old.

french.text: Qui court deux lièvres à la fois, n’en prend aucun.
french.description: You must not run after two hares at the same time.

french.text: Qui écoute aux portes, entend souvent sa propre honte.
french.description: Eavesdroppers hear no good of themselves.

french.text: Qui m’aime aime mon chien.
french.description: Love me, love my dog.

french.text: Qui mal commence, mal achève.
french.description: A bad beginning makes a bad ending.

french.text: Qui ne fait pas quand póte, nu face cand vrea.
french.description: He that will not when he may, when he will he may have nay.

french.text: Qui ne risque rien n’a rien.
french.description: Who risks nothing, gets nothing.

french.text: Qui ne sait obéir, ne sait commander.
french.description: Who has not served cannot command.

french.text: Qui parle trop, manque souvent.
french.description: Least said, soonest mended.

french.text: Qui parle trop, personne ne l’écoute.
french.description: Who talks too much, nobody listens to.

french.text: Qui s’attend à l’accueil d’autrui, a souvent mal dîné.
french.description: Who expects the bowl of others makes a poor dinner.

french.text: Qui se détourne évite le danger.
french.description: Better finger off as ay wagging.

french.text: Qui se resemble, s’assemble.
french.description: Like will to like.

french.text: Qui sème peu, peu récolte.
french.description: Sow thin, shear thin.

french.text: Qui s’excuse, s’accuse.
french.description: Who makes excuses, himself accuses; or He who excuses himself accuses himself.

french.text: Qui trop embrasse mal étreint.
french.description: Grasp all, lose all.

french.text: Qui se croit sage est un grand fou.
french.description: The first chapter of fools is to think themselves wise.

french.text: Qui se fait brebis, le loup le mange.
french.description: He that makes himself an ass must not take it ill if men ride him.

french.text: Qui sème le vent, récolte la tempête.
french.description: Translation 1: As you sow, so you shall reap.

french.text: Qui veut plaire à tout le monde doit se lever de bonne heure.
french.description: He had need rise early who would please everybody.

french.text: Qui vole un œuf vole un bœuf.
french.description: He who steals an egg will steal an ox.

french.text: Rendre le bien pour le mal.
french.description: If life gives you lemons, make lemonade.

french.text: Rejeter le bon et le mauvais.
french.description: To reject the good with the bad.

french.text: Revenons à nos moutons.
french.description: Let us get back to our sheep.

french.text: Sans deniers Georges ne chante.
french.description: You can’t get something for nothing.

french.text: Sans tentation, il n’y a point de victoire.
french.description: Where there is no temptation there is no glory.

french.text: Santé passe richesse.
french.description: Good health is above wealth.

french.text: Se couper le nez pour faire dépit à son visage.
french.description: English equivalent: He cut off his nose to spite his face.

french.text: HistoriettesHoyt’s New Cyclopedia Of Practical Quotations
Si tu t’en fuis le, il te suivra, ce t’en fuiz, il s’en fuira.
french.description: Follow glory and it will flee, flee glory and it will follow thee.

french.text: Selon l’argent, la besogne.
french.description: What pay, such work.

french.text: Si jeunesse savait, si vieillesse pouvait.
french.description: Youth is wasted on the young.

french.text: Si la montagne ne va pas à Mahomet, Mahomet ira à la montagne.
french.description: Translation and If the mountain will not come to Mohammed, Mohammed must go to the mountain.

french.text: Si le ciel tombait il y aurait bien des alouettes prises.
french.description: If the sky falls, we shall catch larks.

french.text: Si tous disent que tu es un âne, brais.
french.description: When all men say you are an ass it is time to bray.

french.text: Souvent on a coutume de baiser la main qu’on voudrait qui fût brûlée.
french.description: Many kiss the hand they wish cut off.

french.text: Tant crie l’on Noël, qu’il vient.
french.description: So much does one shout "Christmas" that at last it comes!

french.text: Tant va la cruche à l’eau qu’enfin elle se brise.
french.description: Adrien de Montluc, Comedie de Proverbes, Act I, scene I (translation by Lidias); Molière, Le Festin de Pierre, Act V, scene II (translation by Sganarelle).

french.text: Tel maître, tel valet.
french.description: Like master, like man.

french.text: Tel père, tel fils.
french.description: Such father, such sons.

french.text: Telle mère, telle fille.
french.description: Such mother, such daughter.

french.text: Tirer les marrons de la patte du chat.
french.description: To pull the chestnuts from the fire with the cat’s paw.

french.text: Tout ce qui branle ne tombe pas.
french.description: Bitter pills may have blessed effects.

french.text: Tout chemin mène à Rome.
french.description: All roads lead to Rome.

french.text: Tout est bien que finit bien.
french.description: All is well that ends well.

french.text: Tout homme qui a compagnon d’office à un Maître.
french.description: English equivalent: He that hath a fellow ruler, hath a fellow over-ruler.

french.text: Tout vient à point à qui sait attendre.
french.description: All things come to those who can wait.

french.text: Trop enquérir n’est pas bon.
french.description: Inquiring is not good.

french.text: Un clou chasse l’autre.
french.description: One nail drives out another.

french.text: Un jour sans vin est comme un jour sans soleil.
french.description: A day without wine is like a day without sunshine.

french.text: Un mal et un péril ne vient jamais seul.
french.description: Philippe de Commines, Mémoires, Livre III, Chapter V; reported in Thomas Benfield Harbottle and Philip Hugh Dalbiac, Dictionary of Quotations (French and Italian) (1904), p. 229.

french.text: Un peu d’aide fait grand bien.
french.description: Every little helps.

french.text: Un point fait à temps en sauve cent.
french.description: A stitch in time saves nine.

french.text: Un tiens vaut, ce dit-on, mieux que deux tu l’auras.
french.description: A bird in hand is worth two in a bush.

french.text: Une hirondelle ne fait pas le printemps.
french.description: A swallow doesn’t make the summer.

french.text: Ventre affamé n’a point d’oreilles.
french.description: Words are wasted on a starving man.

french.text: Money is a good servant but a bad master.
Vanity has no greater foe than vanity.
Promising and performing are two things.
He is past preaching who does not care to do well.
Better be envied than pitied.
Life is half spent before one knows what life is.
Good advice is often annoying, bad advice never is.
In love, there is always one who kisses and one who offers the cheek.
Vive la différence.
french.description: Long live the difference (between the sexes, or any difference).

french.text: Vouloir, c’est pouvoir.
french.description: Where there’s a will there’s a way.

french.text: Un mal n’arrive jamais seul.
french.description: it never rains but it pours. the french proverb literally means ‘one bad thing never comes alone.’

french.text: Un petit service en vaut un autre.
french.description: you scratch my back and i’ll scratch yours (literally, one good turn deserves, or is worth, another).

french.text: Un point à temps en vaut cent.
french.description: a stitch in time saves nine. the french proverb translates literally as ‘a stitch in time is worth a hundred.’

french.text: Un tiens vaut mieux que deux tu l’auras.
french.description: a bird in the hand is worth two in the bush.

french.text: Une minute d’hésitation peut coûter cher.
french.description: he who hesitates is lost.

french.text: It is more difficult for beautiful women to stay chaste.
It’s difficult to chain up an old dog.
In love and war don’t seek counsel.
War is much too serious a matter to be entrusted to the military.
Better being alone than in bad company.
Marriage teaches you to live alone.
A party of one alone is not a party.
Tough times don’t last but tough people do.
What was hard to endure is sweet to recall.
If the wine bothers you while you work, stop working.
When you are rich you suffer in a more comfortable way.
We must learn from life how to suffer it.
Write injuries in the sand, kindnesses in marble.
Show me a liar, and I’ll show you a thief.
Set a thief to catch a thief.
Save a thief from the gallows and he will cut your throat.
Justifying a fault doubles it.
Widows comfort themselves when they remarry, widowers take revenge.
There are no beautiful prisons or ugly loved ones.
Why kill time when one can employ it?.
There are more buyers than connoisseurs.
When everybody is wrong then everybody is right.
Those who are absent are always wrong.
Quarrels do not last long if the wrong is only on one side.
Everyone blames his memory, but never his judgment.
Nothing dries so fast as tears.
In youth, one has tears without grief; in age, grief without tears.
A woman’s heart dries quicker than her tears.
The doctor is often more to be feared than the disease.
For most people love of justice is no more than the fear to suffer injustice.
Courage is often caused by fear.
Fear is a great inventor.
Fear and restlessness kill more than do illnesses.
He who comes from afar may lie without fear of contradiction as he is sure to be listened to with the utmost attention.
A man who is afraid of suffering suffers from fear itself.
Work relieves us from three great evils, boredom, vice, and want.
He who seeks evil will find it.
Let him who is cold blow the fire.
If the fire does not burn you the smoke will blacken you.
Better a small fire that warms you than a big one that burns you.
What you lose in the fire, you will find amongst the ashes.
The first love letters are written with the eyes.
Loving with the eyes only, has blinded a lot of fools.
Fields have eyes and woods have ears.
Whoever rubs himself with garlic will not smell of cloves.
Too many doctors too few medicines.
In a good family the husband is deaf and the wife blind.
You hear little from the drummer that is paid in advance.
Every doctor thinks his pills are the best.
The graveyards are full of young lawyers, lost inheritance and young doctors.
Where wine appears the doctor disappears.
A surgeon should be young a physician old.
Better the second husband of a widow than the first.
He who marries a widow also marries her debts.
You cannot satisfy the whole world and your father.
Mean fathers, wasteful sons.
The city that negotiates is half conquered.
It is good to dance on another man’s floor.
Where power reigns there is no room for reason.
None are more haughty than a common place person raised to power.
One may go a long way after one is tired.
Who loves well, chastises well.
Only great men may have great faults.
Great talker, great liar.
Great boasters, little doers.
Mistrust is the mother of certainty.
The worst is not always certain but it’s very likely.
We make big promises to avoid little presents.
Liberty has no crueler enemy than license.
A silent woman is a gift from God.
We must have reasons for speech but we need none for silence.
Beauty is silent eloquence.
It is a sorry house in which the cock is silent and the hen crows.
Silence is the soul of all things.
The silence of the people is a warning for the king.
It is easier to climb down than up.
What you keep rots; what you give flourishes.
A day is lost if one has not laughed.
They will be hushed by a good deed who laughs at a wise speech.
Laughing is not always the proof of a mind at ease.
When glory comes, memory departs.
When one has one’s hand full of truth it is not always wise to open it.
Only the truth hurts.
It’s a big wind that blows on small doors.
